content:
Do we have anyone who is familiar with differential Galois theory etc?

feat(FieldTheory/Differential/Liouville): prove the algebraic case of Liouville's theorem #16797

I followed a seminar on this topic ~ 4 years ago. But I would be happy to defer to an expert.

I have to say that I (the author of this PR) also don't know this subject well at all, I was just following Rosenlicht, M. Integration in Finite Terms, so it would be great if someone familiar with this could take a look
Bumping this. @Antoine Chambert-Loir made a review I addressed, and I also added some comments explaining the idea of the proof
I added one remark about all the Liouville properties being given as typeclasses and proved as instances.
As far as I can see, there are no problematic instances.
